channel.title: Analysis on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Analysis on A Hugo website

item.title: Set theory
item.description: Suppose \(Y\subset X\) and \(E\) is open relative to \(Y\), then, to each \(p\in E\), there is a positive number \(r_p\) and the condition \(q\in Y\), \(d(p,q)<r_p\) imply that \(q\in E\). Let \(V_p\) be the set of all \(q\in X\) such that \(d(p,q)<r_p\) and define \[G=\underset{p\in E}{\cup} V_p\] Then \(G\) is an open subset of \(X\), since \(p\in V_p\) for all \(p\in E\), it is clear that \(E\subset G\cap Y\).
